intro: Pleurophyllum, commonly known as the golden weed, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to New Zealand and consists of several species, many of which are found in alpine and subalpine regions. The plants typically have upright stems and are characterized by their showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. They are often found in rocky or gravelly soils and are adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Pleurophyllum species are also noted for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional Māori medicine.
